Some common pests and diseases that can affect strawberries include:

1. Strawberry aphids: These small insects can cause stunted growth, distortion of leaves and branches, and yellowing of leaves. They are usually found on the undersides of leaves. Prevention includes removing weeds, keeping the area clean and well-drained, and using insecticidal soap.

2. Spider mites: These tiny pests are difficult to see, but they cause yellow spots on leaves and webs around the plant. Prevention includes removing weeds, keeping the area clean and well-drained, and using insecticidal soap.

3. Botrytis cinerea: This fungal disease can cause gray mold on ripe strawberries, as well as on leaves and stems. Prevention includes proper plant spacing, proper irrigation practices, and avoiding overhead watering.

4. Verticillium wilt: This fungal disease can cause yellowing and wilting of leaves, and can cause the plant to die. Prevention includes planting resistant varieties, avoiding over-watering, and avoiding overcrowding.

5. Gray mold: This fungal disease can cause a gray, fuzzy mold on the berries. Prevention includes harvesting ripe strawberries promptly, keeping the area clean and well-drained, and avoiding overhead watering.

Overall, prevention includes keeping the area clean, well-drained, and properly irrigated. Additionally, choosing disease-resistant varieties and avoiding overcrowding can help prevent pests and diseases. If you suspect a pest or disease problem, consult with a professional or your local extension office for proper treatment options.
